hook.text: A digital Gucci bag sold for more than the physical version. Welcome to virtual fashion.

buildup.text: Brands like Nike, Adidas, and Louis Vuitton launched NFT collections for virtual avatars and metaverse worlds.

discovery.text: RTFKT, acquired by Nike, sold virtual sneakers as NFTs. Owners could wear them in games and social platforms.

twist.text: Most virtual fashion has no interoperability. Your sneakers work in one game but not another.

climax.text: Digital fashion makes sense for a generation that lives online. The infrastructure just isn't there yet.

punchline.text: People pay real money for clothes their avatars wear.

quiz.question: What is a major challenge for digital fashion NFTs?
options: Items don't work across different platforms
